Last two versions of WebStorm either take 2-4 minutes to load or crash all the time or eat all the available memory so the laptop stops responding for a few minutes. It seems that JetBrains can't test WebStorm on Ubuntu 20.04 before they publish the tool the developers pay for.

I had to go back two versions before I got anything stable and more or less working. Although it still crashes, but much less frequently.

There is no reason for an IDE to collect data involuntarily. Read the privacy policy, it's a giant red flag. These companies think they have the right to siphon information from your computer, and if you trade your privacy for convenience, it ends with more big tech monopolies controlling your life. Stick with open source. These practices should be outlawed, and the CEOs taken to trial for violations of basic human rights. Disgusting.

description:
Best of the best 
Best of the best 
Best of the best

WebStorm is a full blown IDE that every web developer appreciates. (I'm saying that as a developer with 15+ years of experiences under my belt)
Be aware that after 1st month of trial you have to pay a couple of dollars per month.
But why when there are so many great free text editors like Visual Studio Code? Because WebStorm is everything at one place (git, database, tests, etc.) with the best intellisense, great customisation, etc. And if you need other language outside JS, you can easily grab PhpStorm, Rider or other from Jetbrains family and you will be familiar with that IDE.
Try it and you won't come back to free alternatives.
